content:
• Wednesday, June 5, 2013
  • KAEPY

    Kansai Electric Power (OTCPK:KAEPY -4%) slips again today, after losing more than 9% in the...

    Kansai Electric Power (OTCPK:KAEPY -4%) slips again today, after losing more than 9% in the previous session, as Prime Minister Shinzo Abe says shuttered nuclear power plants will resume operations, but only after their safety was guaranteed.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • SSKN

    MELA Sciences (MELA) files a $75 million mixed securities shelf with the SEC. Shares -19% AH.

    MELA Sciences (MELA) files a $75 million mixed securities shelf with the SEC. Shares -19% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 PM
  • FCEL

    More on FuelCell (NASDAQ:FCEL): FQ2 beats solidly across the board as total sales jumped 75%...

    More on FuelCell (NASDAQ:FCEL): FQ2 beats solidly across the board as total sales jumped 75% Y/Y. Net losses narrowed as margins widened to 5.5% from 0.01%, aided by a diverse sales mix. Product sales, which make up the bulk of revenue, jumped 84% to $34.4M due to higher fuel cell kit sales and revenue from its Bridgeport fuel cell park project. Service and license revenues were up 19%, while advanced technologies contract revenue nearly doubled. Shares +12.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:56 PM | 6 Comments
  • FCEL

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL): FQ2 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $42.4M (+75.7% Y/Y)...

    FuelCell Energy (NASDAQ:FCEL): FQ2 EPS of -$0.04 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $42.4M (+75.7% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +10.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:27 PM
  • RJETQ

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RJET +4%. GTAT +4%. CQB +4%. LIOX +3%. COHU +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RJET +4%. GTAT +4%. CQB +4%. LIOX +3%. COHU +3%.
    After-hours top losers: PAY -12%. ASNA -10%. VRA -8%. FRAN -7%. ACTV -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • FRAN

    More on Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN) Q1: Comps growth and revenue growth come in at 2% and 29%...

    More on Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN) Q1: Comps growth and revenue growth come in at 2% and 29% respectively. The company opens 56 new boutiques during the period in line with its "key growth initiatives." Direct-to-consumer sales rise 97% Y/Y and now account for more than 2% of quarterly sales. Outlook: management sees Q2 and FY13 EPS of $0.35-0.36 and $1.27-1.30 respectively on sales of between $94.5-95.5M for Q2 and between $365-370M for the full year. Analysts are looking for EPS of $1.30 for the full year — shares -7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • RST

    Rosetta Stone (NYSE:RST) announces a 3.5M share secondary offering. The selling stockholders,...

    Rosetta Stone (NYSE:RST) announces a 3.5M share secondary offering. The selling stockholders, ABS Capital Partners IV Trust and Norwest Equity Partners VIII, LP, are offering 3,490,000 shares, with Rosetta Stone rounding it out with 10,000 shares. RST intends to use the net proceeds from its 10K shares to pay for the fees and expenses incurred in connection with the offering. The company will not receive any proceeds from the sale of the shares offered by the selling stockholders. Shares -1.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW, EMC) +1.6% AH after COO Carl Eschenback tries to use a BofA/Merrill conference talk...

    VMware (VMW, EMC) +1.6% AH after COO Carl Eschenback tries to use a BofA/Merrill conference talk to reassure investors on edge over EMC's cash flow guidance and downbeat sell-side commentary. Eschenbach has reiterated VMware's Q2/2013 guidance and operating cash flow targets (the latter might be below consensus), is optimistic about a 2H demand pickup, and claims the vCloud Suite is seeing good momentum. Shares fell 2.5% in regular trading following Deutsche's downgrade.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • ENDP

    Endo Health Solutions (NASDAQ:ENDP) rises 2% AH after announcing initiatives to drive...

    Endo Health Solutions (NASDAQ:ENDP) rises 2% AH after announcing initiatives to drive shareholder value. Among the company's plans: A $325M reduction in annual operating expenses, the exploration of strategic alternatives for its HealthTronics business, the pursuit of "accretive acquisitions," and the improvement of R&D efficiency. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • FRAN

    Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN): Q1 EPS of $0.26 in-line. Revenue of $79M (+29% Y/Y) misses by $0.54M....

    Francesca's (NASDAQ:FRAN): Q1 EPS of $0.26 in-line. Revenue of $79M (+29% Y/Y) misses by $0.54M. Shares -5.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY): FQ2 EPS of $0.42 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $430M misses by $10.29M....

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY): FQ2 EPS of $0.42 misses by $0.05. Revenue of $430M misses by $10.29M. Shares -8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 3 Comments
  • WDAY

    Workday (WDAY +2.7%) is closing with a solid gain after FBR's David Hilal launches coverage with...

    Workday (WDAY +2.7%) is closing with a solid gain after FBR's David Hilal launches coverage with a Market Perform and $64 PT. Though Hilal isn't a fan of Workday's "premium valuation," many others on the Street have aired similar concerns. Thus, investors are focusing on Hilal's expectations for strong growth thanks to still-rising penetration for Workday's core cloud HR software, the cross-selling of financial and other software, product line expansion, international expansion, and a growing distributor base.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • YGE

    Shares of Yingli Green Energy (YGE -4.5%) burst higher, then fall back, on headlines that the...

    Shares of Yingli Green Energy (YGE -4.5%) burst higher, then fall back, on headlines that the solar company entered into a one-year, $100M deal with DuPont (DD -2.2%), extending a 2012 agreement. The deal includes a supply of solar materials from YGE to DD, installation of a solar power plant at DD and co-marketing initiatives.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • CAA

    Standard Pacific (SPF +1%) gets a lift from BAML's Michael Roxland, who initiated coverage today...

    Standard Pacific (SPF +1%) gets a lift from BAML's Michael Roxland, who initiated coverage today with a Buy and an $11 price target. Roxland says the homebuilder's focus on move-up and luxury homebuyers and long land position in land constrained markets give it a competitive advantage. Additionally, its healthy order growth versus its peers, growing end markets, and geographic exposure should generate industry leading gross margins, which should expand as the company grows its community count.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM
  • DLR

    There's no evident news, but Digital Realty Trust (DLR +6%) goes its own way today after falling...

    There's no evident news, but Digital Realty Trust (DLR +6%) goes its own way today after falling about 15% over the last 6 weeks (helped along by a very bearish presentation at Ira Sohn).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 4 Comments
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS -5%) is down 3.8% to $14.04 after the company reported in an SEC proxy filing that...

    Vivus (VVUS -5%) is down 3.8% to $14.04 after the company reported in an SEC proxy filing that First Manhattan is calling for the replacemnet of the company's entire board of directors, and replacing it with its own slate of nine director nominees. VVUS CEO Leland Wilson countered in his response, urging shareholders to vote against the replacement.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • CELG

    Celgene (CELG -4.3%) gets FDA approval for its supplemental new drug application for Revlimid to...

    Celgene (CELG -4.3%) gets FDA approval for its supplemental new drug application for Revlimid to treat mantle cell lymphoma. The drug is already cleared for multiple myeloma, another white blood cell cancer. Analysts estimate the drug could generate around $5.9B in sales in 2016.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 3 Comments
  • KTOS

    Kratos Defense & Security Solutions (KTOS -1.2%) says it's received contract awards totaling...

    Kratos Defense & Security Solutions (KTOS -1.2%) says it's received contract awards totaling around $4M for specialized equipment in support of certain radar related and other classified National Security programs. The specialized products will be produced in secure manufacturing facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -2.8%) keeps falling as yesterday's shareholder meeting (it apparently featured ~25...

    Zynga (ZNGA -2.8%) keeps falling as yesterday's shareholder meeting (it apparently featured ~25 shareholders and no media) fails to create enthusiasm following its layoffs and bookings warning. Mark Pincus promises the restructuring will yield a culture change. "We want to get back to being a nimble company that moves quickly to innovate, iterate, and find the player heat." But Pac Crest is unimpressed. "Unfortunately, cutting [Zynga's] worst developers will not make its best any better." Meanwhile, Zynga's rivals claim they're faring better (Facebook's Q1 payments data arguably backs that up). (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM | 2 Comments
  • OGXPY

    Shares of beaten down OGX Petroleum (OTCPK:OGXPY +1.7%) are bucking today's Brazilian selloff on...

    Shares of beaten down OGX Petroleum (OTCPK:OGXPY +1.7%) are bucking today's Brazilian selloff on better production numbers; oil and gas output in May climbed to 18.2K bbl/day, recovering from April when the company was forced to repair equipment. Most Brazilian shares (EWZ -1.8%), including Petrobras (PBR -3.6%), are sharply lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS -0.7%) says it will repurchase $2B worth of common stock, according to a...

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS -0.7%) says it will repurchase $2B worth of common stock, according to a Bloomberg headline.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 5 Comments
  • CEO

    Cnooc (CEO -1.6%) is partnering with Iceland's Eykon Energy in an application for a license to...

    Cnooc (CEO -1.6%) is partnering with Iceland's Eykon Energy in an application for a license to explore and produce oil and gas offshore Iceland, which would mark the Chinese company's first foray into offshore Arctic oil drilling as well as the first entry of a major oil company into Iceland's oil sector.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT -1.4%) slips after Goldman cut its price target to $97 and reduced 2013-15...

    Caterpillar (CAT -1.4%) slips after Goldman cut its price target to $97 and reduced 2013-15 estimates by 10% earlier today. The firm cites soft mining capex and limited cyclical upside in its core Power Systems markets for the lower numbers.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • AXLL

    Axiall (AXLL +3.1%) gets a boost from a BofA initiation at Buy (price target $56). Analyst...

    Axiall (AXLL +3.1%) gets a boost from a BofA initiation at Buy (price target $56). Analyst Aleksey Yefremov says the company should benefit "from the US housing recovery with 47% of sales directly tied to the industry and another 20% indirectly." In May, the shares suffered a nasty sell-off after high ethylene costs and lower resin sales prices conspired with a decrease in sales in the building products division to hurt quarterly results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 2 Comments
  • RES

    Fracking services provider RPC (RES +5.8%) surges after saying it will buy back an additional 5M...

    Fracking services provider RPC (RES +5.8%) surges after saying it will buy back an additional 5M shares, an indication it feels strongly about its long-term potential and inherent value, Iberia Capital analyst Trey Stolz says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • DG

    Dollar General's (DG +3.1%) "rare misstep" (I, II) provides investors with an "attractive entry...

    Dollar General's (DG +3.1%) "rare misstep" (I, II) provides investors with an "attractive entry point," according to Wells Fargo analyst Matt Nemer, who believes the fundamental story for the company is unchanged. What with opening 165 new stores and relocating another 207, there were simply "too many balls in the air" during Q1, Nemer says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -1.7%) dips today, despite its announcement that six abstracts from...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -1.7%) dips today, despite its announcement that six abstracts from its cystic fibrosis program will be presented at the 36th European Cystic Fibrosis Society Conference in Lisbon, Portugal, June 12 to 15, 2013. Presentations will include data from Cohorts 2 and 3 of a Phase 2 study of lumacaftor, and data from a Phase 2 study of VX-661. Additionally, poster presentations will feature data on the use of KALYDECO.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • FAST

    Fastenal (FAST -5.3%) slides after Susquehanna says daily sales data (5.3% growth in May, below...

    Fastenal (FAST -5.3%) slides after Susquehanna says daily sales data (5.3% growth in May, below expectations) betray an inherently weak environment for manufacturing and capex.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • FSLR

    Maxim restarts coverage on First Solar (FSLR -3.3%) with a Sell and $42 PT.  The firm...

    Maxim restarts coverage on First Solar (FSLR -3.3%) with a Sell and $42 PT.  The firm downgraded First Solar to Sell in April '12 (shares are up 147% since then), and issued a string of bearish reports afterwards. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • EXFO

    EXFO -4.64% falls after saying Tuesday evening that FQ3 revenues will come in below guidance...

    EXFO -4.64% falls after saying Tuesday evening that FQ3 revenues will come in below guidance causing the company to swing to a projected net loss of $0.02-0.01 per share, versus previous guidance for a net profit. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • WPRT

    Westport Innovations (WPRT -2.6%) gives back gains made earlier in the day after it said that...

    Westport Innovations (WPRT -2.6%) gives back gains made earlier in the day after it said that Canadian National Railway (CNI -2.7%) had placed an order for four LNG tenders from it for an unspecified amount. The first tender will be delivered in Q413.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM | 4 Comments
  • CVGW

    It's not always easy to gain market-share in the avocado business - just ask Calavo Growers...

    It's not always easy to gain market-share in the avocado business - just ask Calavo Growers (CVGW -2.5%), whose shares are suffering today after initiatives designed to expand industry leadership cut into Q2 earnings. Nevertheless, the strategy should benefit CVGW's bottom line going forward CEO Lee Cole says, and the company did say revenue increased by 20% Y/Y during the period. In fact, CVGW's expansion (40% more product packed and shipped) single-handedly added 4% to the avocado industry's Y/Y growth in Q2. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • MFRM

    Piper Jaffray sees quite a bit of upside in shares of Mattress Firm (MFRM +6.5%) as analyst...

    Piper Jaffray sees quite a bit of upside in shares of Mattress Firm (MFRM +6.5%) as analyst Peter Keith ups his price target to $48 from $42 citing improving industry trends, accretion from Mattress Giant stores, and expanding product margins. (See: MFRM turns in comfortable quarter)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:14 PM
  • KMDA

    Kamada (KMDA -3.5%) closes its 6.4M share offering at $9.25 per share. All of the shares of...

    Kamada (KMDA -3.5%) closes its 6.4M share offering at $9.25 per share. All of the shares of common stock in the offering were offered by KMDA and include 837,395 shares issued pursuant to the over-allotment option granted to the underwriters, which was exercised in full.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • TLP

    TransMontaigne Partners (TLP -1.3%) announces a 900K-barrel expansion at the Battleground Oil...

    TransMontaigne Partners (TLP -1.3%) announces a 900K-barrel expansion at the Battleground Oil Specialty Terminal under construction on the Houston Ship Channel. The ~$54M expansion is supported by a long-term leased storage and handling services contract with Morgan Stanley Capital. Kinder Morgan Partners (KMP -2.8%) owns a 55% stake in the complex, with TLP holding the remainder.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • MON

    Monsanto (MON -3.3%) calls the genetically modified wheat found in Oregon an isolated...

    Monsanto (MON -3.3%) calls the genetically modified wheat found in Oregon an isolated occurrence, likely the result of an accident or deliberate mixing of seeds. MON says tests of 600 samples of each of two wheat varieties planted by an Oregon farmer show no presence of the experimental Roundup Ready wheat, and tests of 30K wheat samples in Oregon and Washington also show no contamination.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 10 Comments
  • CYBX

    Cyberonics (CYBX +4.3%) moves up after FQ4 earnings beat expectations, fueled by record sales...

    Cyberonics (CYBX +4.3%) moves up after FQ4 earnings beat expectations, fueled by record sales and strong international growth. International unit sales surged a record 27% in the quarter, outpacing the 17% growth seen in US, which was also a record. For FY14, the company ups expectations, now expecting sales in the range of $279M to $283M, above Street estimates of $276M.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • PRSN

    BSD Medical (BSDM +2.3%) says it's delivered a BSD-2000 Hyperthermia System to Cancer Treatment...

    BSD Medical (BSDM +2.3%) says it's delivered a BSD-2000 Hyperthermia System to Cancer Treatment Centers of America, making it the eighth BSD Hyperthermia system purchased by CTCA. The system delivers localized therapeutic heating by applying radiofrequency energy, which can be used to target the shape, size and location of a tumor.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • ATW

    Atwood Oceanics (ATW +2.1%) is awarded a drilling services contract by Shell for its...

    Atwood Oceanics (ATW +2.1%) is awarded a drilling services contract by Shell for its ultra-deepwater semisubmersible Atwood Condor rig. The drilling program will be performed in the Gulf of Mexico at a dayrate of ~$555K. The contract adds ~$502M in revenue backlog.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper (JNPR +5.6%) spikes higher after CEO Kevin Johnson states at a BofA/Merrill conference...

    Juniper (JNPR +5.6%) spikes higher after CEO Kevin Johnson states at a BofA/Merrill conference his company is seeing a pickup in carrier router spend. Though Juniper's enterprise security ops struggled in Q1, its service provider sales grew 4% Y/Y, thanks in large part to healthy core/edge router demand. Market leader Cisco (CSCO +0.9%) has moved higher in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • JASO

    Solar stocks see a bit of profit-taking after Goldman downgrades JA Solar (JASO -9.3%) and Trina...

    Solar stocks see a bit of profit-taking after Goldman downgrades JA Solar (JASO -9.3%) and Trina (TSL -6%), and the EU officially announces Chinese module tariffs that will only total 11.8% for now, but could soar as high as 67.9% on Aug. 6 if a settlement isn't reached. Yingli (YGE -5.4%) states its tariff will rise to 37.3% on Aug. 6, which it claims is "the lowest rate" of all Chinese mobile vendors. Trina says its tariff will rise to 51.5%. LDK -5.2%. CSIQ -3.5%. JKS -3.2%. CSUN -4.1%. SOL -4.4%. FSLR -3.4%. CSIQ -3.5% in spite of its solar plant sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • ARRY

    Array Biopharma (ARRY -2.4%) slips after pricing its previously announced $115M offering of...

    Array Biopharma (ARRY -2.4%) slips after pricing its previously announced $115M offering of convertible senior notes, with a 30-day option for underwriters to purchase up to an additional $17.25M. The notes will bear interest at a rate of 3.0% per year, payable semi-annually, and will mature on June 1, 2020.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (WLT +1.8%) spikes higher after disclosing it has begun exploring options to...

    Walter Energy (WLT +1.8%) spikes higher after disclosing it has begun exploring options to refinance a portion of its existing debt. Terms of the proposed new debt facilities would replace existing term loan A and B facilities with a new term loan B facility and new senior unsecured debt as well as extend the maturity of its indebtedness. Shares had been mired in the red before the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 3 Comments
  • BMRN

    BioMarin Pharmaceutical (BMRN -1.8%) initiates Phase 3 studies for PEG-PAL, or PEGylated...

    BioMarin Pharmaceutical (BMRN -1.8%) initiates Phase 3 studies for PEG-PAL, or PEGylated recombinant Phenylalanine Ammonia Lyase, for the treatment of the genetic disorder phenylketonuria. In Phase 2 trials, the drug was shown to dramatically reduce blood Phe levels and the company is looking to achieve the same outcome in next phase.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • ELY

    Wedbush says recent channel checks reveal "unusually heavy, and perhaps even somewhat...

    Wedbush says recent channel checks reveal "unusually heavy, and perhaps even somewhat irrational" promotions by TaylorMade, which analyst Rommel Dionisio says could hurt Callaway Golf (ELY -3.5%) which gets a downgrade to Neutral and a reduced price target of $7.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • CZR

    Casino stocks are taking the weak economic news worse than other sectors as they under-perform...

    Casino stocks are taking the weak economic news worse than other sectors as they under-perform major indexes. Bets on Vegas are going south at a higher rate than bets on Macau. Decliners: Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR) -6.2%, Boyd Gaming (NYSE:BYD) -5.5%, MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) -3.3%, Pinnacle Entertainment (NASDAQ:PNK) -2.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP +4.4%) will benefit from a pending Apple Maps overhaul that will "significantly...

    Yelp (YELP +4.4%) will benefit from a pending Apple Maps overhaul that will "significantly improve the user experience," argues Wedge Partners' Brian Blair. He sees the update to the oft-criticized Maps, which features heavy Yelp integration, bolstering the local reviews leader's already-strong mobile momentum. Blair trumpets the fact 36% of Yelp's Q1 ad impressions were mobile-related, up from 25% in Q4. (Yelp Q1 data)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 3 Comments
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -3.4%) is among the S&P's worst performers, as global iron ore...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -3.4%) is among the S&P's worst performers, as global iron ore capacity is expected to increase faster than demand from China, continuing to weigh on prices, according to the head of Baosteel, China's third-biggest mill. Steel output growth has dropped to less than 5%/year from 20% between 2000-06. BHP -2.9%, RIO -1.8%, VALE -1.8%. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY -3.8%) takes a bit of mid-day pressure ahead of its pending delisting from the...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY -3.8%) takes a bit of mid-day pressure ahead of its pending delisting from the Nasdaq tomorrow. The company plans to list on the OTCBB. The company was notified by regulators late last week that it was operating as a "public shell" and following the voluntary recall of Omontys, it no longer has an operating business.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • BTU

    Global thermal coal prices are unlikely to recover this year unless Australian coal producers...

    Global thermal coal prices are unlikely to recover this year unless Australian coal producers lower production or an unexpected event rattles the seaborne market and sends prices north, industry experts at the Coaltrans Asia conference say. Coal (KOL -1%) names are weak in early trading: BTU -1.2%, CLF -3.1%, ACI -1.2%, ANR -1.8%, WLT -2%, BHP -2.5%, CNX -1%, CLD -1.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • MTL

    Shares in Mechel OAO (MTL -3.8%) slide, despite its earlier announcement that it had signed a...

    Shares in Mechel OAO (MTL -3.8%) slide, despite its earlier announcement that it had signed a coking coal supply agreement with China's Shasteel Group. No financials were disclosed. Under the terms of the agreement, MTL's Singapore subsidiary will directly supply Shasteel Group with 40K to 80K tons of coking coal per month, starting in June. Prices will be determined on a monthly basis. Mechel Carbon has already supplied more than 500K tons of coking coal this year to Shasteel's main coke plant in Zhangjiagang, Jiangsu Province.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • HNR

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR +30%) soars after reporting Q1 earnings of $0.11/share not...

    Harvest Natural Resources (HNR +30%) soars after reporting Q1 earnings of $0.11/share not including the impact of Venezuela’s currency devaluation and other adjustments. Petrodelta produced an average of ~37.3K bbl/day, up 13% Y/Y, and 8.6M cu. ft./day of natural gas. Petrodelta's 2013 production is projected at ~42K bbl/day, with a capital budget of ~$210M.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • XTNT

    Bacterin (BONE -3.2%) slips today after announcing an offering of 8.51M unregistered shares of...

    Bacterin (BONE -3.2%) slips today after announcing an offering of 8.51M unregistered shares of its common stock and warrants to purchase 4.25M additional shares. For each share purchased, investors will get a warrant to purchase 0.5 shares at an exercise price of $0.72 - a 15% premium to the June 4 closing price. The company says its conducting the offering to boost its balance sheet, and should yield gross proceeds of around $4.85M. It plans to use the proceeds from the sale to fund operations and working capital requirements.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • TROV

    Shares of Trovagene (TROV +3.4%) jump ahead of tomorrow's presentation at the Jefferies Global...

    Shares of Trovagene (TROV +3.4%) jump ahead of tomorrow's presentation at the Jefferies Global Healthcare Conference. Perhaps helping to tip sentiment is a Small-Cap Insight article from bull and SA contributor Logical Assessment who notes that the company's urine tests are protected by some 121 issued patents.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • WBA

    Walgreen (WAG +2%) says comparable store sales rose 2.8% to beat analyst expectations as...

    Walgreen (WAG +2%) says comparable store sales rose 2.8% to beat analyst expectations as pharmacy sales came in strong for the month. Overall, sales rose 4.3% to $5.97B. The comparable runs up against a month from last year when the drugstore operator had just split with Express Scripts.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • AAL

    Bank of America downgrades US Airways (LCC) to an Underperform rating from its previous perch of...

    Bank of America downgrades US Airways (LCC) to an Underperform rating from its previous perch of Neutral. After sizing up the merger with American Airlines, the firm thinks estimates on potential synergies flowing from the deal might be too high. LCC -2.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • AIG

  • EWJ

    The Nikkei (NYSEARCA:EWJ) drops sharply once again and takes other Asian bourses with it, with...

    The Nikkei (NYSEARCA:EWJ) drops sharply once again and takes other Asian bourses with it, with the fall this time because of disappointment with Shinzo Abe's "third arrow" of economic reform. The measures "aren't enough for Japan to achieve sustained economic growth and overcome deflation," says economist Hisashi Yamada, especially as the labor-market reforms don't go far enough. There's also disappointment that Abe isn't proposing to cut corporate taxes, which are amongst the highest in the OECD. Japan -3.8%, Hong Kong -1.1%, China -0.1%, India flat.
